fix: #5096 Prevent stream already closed errors on Http based connectors
pullrequest.body: fixes #5096 This PR add Http request wrapper processors to Http based connectors in order to replace HttpMessage with DefaultMessage on the exchanges. This is because the HttpMessage implementation raises stream closed errors when integration frequently replaces message bodies in out messages (e.g. with data mapper)

pullrequest.body: fixes #4743 @christophd This works but we may want to consider a better bulk update API where I just send the whole integration flow perhaps to figure out data shapes. This solution will start making the editor feel a bit sluggish I suspect when the flow gets longer. I also wound up having to fetch metadata for connections as well when I found that I could remove the mismatch warning on the API provider flow by visiting the config page, as that's (before this PR) the only spot when the UI fetches updated data shapes for a connection.

pullrequest.body: fixes #2896 'cause @kcbabo said so :-) @TovaCohen FYI quick example, also will show "Stopping" and "Starting" during state changes at the moment, dialogs and notifications are update as well: ![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/351660/41920100-f19e1664-792d-11e8-8271-ca63f623ea79.PNG) Also moved all of this text out of the app and into the dictionary file. "Pending" shows up on the chart, previously the chart on the dashboard wasn't showing integrations that were in a transitional state, i.e. starting/stopping. Which looks odd when you start/stop an integration and the total goes to 0 while the integration is transitioning. I've kept "Pending" for this particular case for now, if there's a better term lemme know. I didn't like the idea of having "Running", "Stopped", "Starting" and "Stopping" all in the legend there, seemed a bit much.

Also the popovers used for showing the data mismatch text and the datashape details for connections aren't laid out that well and need some further work. @igarashitm FYI and also I forget, was there an issue for tracking implementing the updated design?

pullrequest.title: [TechExt] Fixed support for html form hints
TechExt added fallback behavior for not optimized queries
pullrequest.body: fixes #1075 Currently Tech Extension behavior is broken. The reason for that is that commit https://github.com/syndesisio/syndesis/commit/8fa6e4f6c23daef46d8590a1f3d04c63269d40e2 introduces a new optimized SQL query based on indexes. The problem with that commit is that it indexes only properties that are annotated as `@UniqueProperty`. When a query that should use non indexed properties is used, the code log the problem as a WARNING but it also throws a blocking exception, breaking previous behavior. That commit also introduced a UNIQUE constraint on a field in Extension model that is not correct, since that field is only part of the primary key, and it breaks update functionality. Current PR introduces a fallback logic to the old behevior, in case of not indexed properties, without reverting the code able to handle optimized queries. **This might not the final fix, but it'd be useful to get it merge, so to restore Tech Ext functionality in the meanwhile.** Also if the previous commit endedup in TP3, we broke Tech Ext behavior in that version.

pullrequest.body: fixes #785, #760 IT tests and manually deploying an integration worked fine here. Notice that now BuildConfig logs are bound to the java logging level set for `io.syndesis.openshift` You have many ways to enable it, I do it patching directly the DeploymentConfig (since it's harder in the template, being the value inside a list): ```bash oc env dc/syndesis-rest JAVA_OPTIONS="$(oc env dc/syndesis-rest --list | grep -P '(?<=JAVA_OPTIONS=)(.*)' -o --color=never) -Dlogging.level.io.syndesis=DEBUG" ```
